paragraph: Michael Kelly Finnigan (April 26, 1945 – August 11, 2021) was an American keyboard player and vocalist, his speciality being the B3 Hammond organ.  Working primarily as a freelance studio musician and touring player, he played with a wide variety of musicians in pop, rock, blues and jazz.

Finnigan was born in Troy, Ohio, and attended the University of Kansas on a basketball scholarship. Finnigan toured with and sessioned for Jimi Hendrix, Joe Cocker, Etta James, Sam Moore, Crosby Stills and Nash, Dave Mason, Buddy Guy, The Manhattan Transfer, Taj Mahal, Michael McDonald, Maria Muldaur, Peter Frampton, Cher, Ringo Starr, Leonard Cohen, Tower of Power, Rod Stewart, David Coverdale, Tracy Chapman, Los Lonely Boys, Bonnie Raitt, and Saving Escape. Finnigan recorded Early Bird Cafe with the Serfs in the late 1960s, with Tom Wilson producing. The Serfs were the house band at a nightclub in Wichita, Kansas at the time. He then toured and cut an album with Jerry Hahn, "the Jerry Hahn Brotherhood" released in 1970. He recorded two solo records in the 1970s, one with Jerry Wood. He later collaborated with two other Columbia artists, Les Dudek and Jim Krueger, with whom he formed DFK (Dudek, Finnigan, and Krueger) in 1978.   Subsequently, his work featured on a CD by The Finnigan Brothers (NashFilms Records), a collaboration with his younger brother Sean and founding member of Bread, Robb Royer.

He was twice a winner of a Blues Music Award (formerly W.C. Handy Award) for his work with Taj Mahal as a member of the Phantom Blues Band. Finnigan was always active politically and was, for several years, a regular contributor to the weblog Crooks and Liars. In 2013 and 2014, Finnigan was nominated for a Blues Music Award in the 'Pinetop Perkins Piano Player' category.

He was married for 50 years to Candy Finnigan, an intervention counselor who appeared on the television show Intervention. They have two children: daughter, Bridget, and son, Kelly. Finnigan was an active blogger, with a fondness for liberal/progressive causes and commentary.
Finnigan died from liver cancer on August 11, 2021, in Los Angeles, aged 76.
1969: The Serfs - The Early Bird Cafe, Capitol Records
1970: The Jerry Hahn Brotherhood – The Jerry Hahn Brotherhood
1971: Big Brother and the Holding Company - How Hard It Is
1978: Mike Finnigan - Black & White, Columbia Records, and CBS
1978: Ben Sidran - A Little Kiss in the Night
1979: The Dudek Finnigan Krueger Band - Special Tour Sampler
1988: Crosby, Stills & Nash & Young – American Dream
1994: Crosby, Stills & Nash – After the Storm
2005: Taj Mahal - Taj Mahal & the Phantom Blues Band Live in St. Lucia
2006: The Phantom Blues Band - Out of the Shadows
2007: Zen Blues Quartet – Again and Yet Again
2007: Joe Cocker – Hymn for My Soul
2008: The Eclectic Beast Band - Living the Music
2010: Various Artists - The Imus Ranch Record II – "Part Time Love" (with the Phantom Blues Band)
2010: Mike Finnigan - Mike Finnigan, Wounded Bird Records
2011: Finnigan & Wood – It's Only a Rock and Roll Show (recorded 1971, previously unreleased)
2011: Trampled Under Foot - Wrong Side of the Blues
2013: Eric Burdon – 'Til Your River Runs Dry
2017: Danielle Nicole - Cry No More, Concord Records
2018: Jay-Bee & the Ultratone Allstars – Life Ain't Got No Shortcuts
